intro: Sphaeranthus incisus, commonly known as the cut-leaved globe flower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are deeply lobed or incised, giving it a distinctive appearance. Sphaeranthus incisus produces small yellow flowers that are arranged in a globular cluster, contributing to its common name.
